lines: Sorry, you're still too young for this experience.  Come back later.
Sorry, you're too old for this experience.

You are sitting in the school library, bored to death. It is a warm spring day and the sun is streaming through the windows, lighting up a square area on the desk in front of you. You are wishing for a distraction to take you away from
the research project you are SUPPOSED to be doing.

Suddenly, a terrific-looking guy walks in and sits in the study area directly across from you. He flashes you a broad smile then settles into his seat and begins work. He seems like the studious type.
Trying to look as intelligent as possible, you start writing furiously, hoping to attract his attention. His eyes remain glued to his own work.
You ask him if he knows what time it is.
He looks up for a brief moment and says, "Time to take a break." He tells you the time, trots off for a few moments then comes back and resumes work.

You're not one who gives up easily. About 10 minutes pass. He gets up from his seat and walks toward the back of the library. You notice that he has left his  books behind. He's heading toward the men's room.
The sun is warm and relaxing. You wish he would come back soon.
You feel a soft hand encircle your shoulder and hear someone whisper, "What are you doing YOUR project on? 'Dreaming'?" The smell of cologne stirs you from your brief nap.
You turn your head to meet the man of your dreams face to face...
You look up...MR. CROMLEY, the LIBRARIAN! Oh, NO! He says, "I haven't been treated to such a flirtatious look in ages. You're so sweet. Now GET BACK TO WORK!" He waddles off.
The guy comes back, picks up his things and leaves.
Later that evening, you leaf through your papers and discover a note.

The note says, "Sat with you in the library today. I think you are an incredible fox. I was too shy to talk to you. If YOU'RE not too shy, why don't you give me a call at 555-9854 -- Paul Pfopmeister"
You call, but the line seems to be constantly busy.
Finally, you hear the line ringing.
Someone picks up the phone..."Hello, City Dump."
Your heart sinks, but you give it one last futile try. "Is Paul there?"
It was Paul's stupid brother playing a joke. Your dreamboat picks up the phone. "Hi. This is Paul."
You introduce yourself and tell him that he has been on your mind all day.

He only goes for the people who are absolutely primo. He thinks you're it. Your Social status sphere suggests that you have the skills to impress him. Your first date with him is this Saturday. Get ready, Baby, those sparks will fly!
Your desire to go through with this risk means that you are not that concerned about your steady boyfriend. He discovers that you are cheating on him and breaks your steady relationship.
Your Social status sphere suggests that you don't have the skills to impress this Paul. He gives you the brush off over the phone, and you never see him again.
